author: BBC News
title: CCTV images released by police investigating disorder in Blackpool
text:
Police have released CCTV images of six men and one woman detectives want to speak to following violent disorder in Blackpool.
A mob of nearly 1,000 people were involved in unrest in the resort on Saturday.
Twenty people were arrested in Blackpool and four people have been charged, with three of those pleading guilty to offences.
Lancashire Police is appealing for help to identify the people in the images and anyone with information about them is asked to get in touch.
Lancashire Police The force is urging anyone who recognises people in the CCTV images to contact them Deputy Chief Constable Sam Mackenzie said he expected the force to make further arrests and charges over the violent disorder.
Lancashire Police Lancashire Police says it expects to make further arrests Bottles and chairs were thrown and police are investigating reports of looting in Houndshill Shopping Centre as the unrest escalated on Saturday.
Lancashire Police Police have also released images of a woman (left) and a sixth man (pictured centre and right) they want to speak to Crowds initially gathered near Blackpool cenotaph and proceeded through the town’s streets, forcing police to cordon off much of the town centre by early evening.
Police also released CCTV images on Wednesday of a man detectives wanted to speak to following a serious assault during disorder on St John’s Square in the resort.
A 50-year-old man sustained two fractures to the skull and a bleed on the brain. He remains in hospital.
Listen to the best of BBC Radio Lancashire on Sounds and follow BBC Lancashire on Facebook , X and Instagram . You can also send story ideas to northwest.newsonline@bbc.co.uk
Related internet links Lancashire Police

author: Josh Foster
title: Big Name Set To Appear On Next WWE Saturday Night's Main Event
text:
WWE Saturday Night’s Main Event returned last month when the show aired live on NBC, and the next quarterly special is set to take place from San Antonio, Texas later this month.
Jesse Ventura made his return to WWE programming last month at Saturday Night’s Main Event, and it was recently reported that Hulk Hogan is set to appear on the next show. Now it seems that another big name is planned for the event.
WrestleVotes noted on Sportskeeda’s Backstage Pass that WWE Hall of Famer Shawn Michaels is set to appear on Saturday Night’s Main Event later this month. It was noted that Michaels likely won’t be doing anything physical, but he will be part of the broadcast.
WWE Saturday Night’s Main Event will air live on Saturday, January 25 and the current card for the show can be seen below.
WWE World Heavyweight Championship
Gunther vs. Jey Uso
WWE Intercontinental Championship
Bron Breakker vs. Sheamus
Stay tuned for updates.

author: VNExplorer
title: South Korea baseball league cancels game due to heat for first time in history
text: SEOUL - South Korea's professional baseball league cancelled a scheduled game on Friday due to high temperatures, the first time in the league's 42-year history that it invoked a provision that allows for a game cancellation due to extreme heat. The game between LG Twins and Lotte Giants was scheduled to start at 6:30 p.m. (0930 GMT) local time in the southeastern city of Ulsan, where the daily high temperatures exceeded 35 degrees Celsius (95 degrees Fahrenheit) for a second straight day on Friday. A Korea Baseball Organization (KBO) official said Friday's heat warning cancellation was the first since the league was launched in 1982. Ground temperatures in the Ulsan stadium were higher than 50 degrees Celsius (122 degrees Fahrenheit) at times during the day, he said. South Korea is under heat warnings for all of the country, a week after the end of the annual monsoon season when heavy rains pounded mostly the central regions causing flooding and landslides. South Korea is in a temperate zone in the northern hemisphere with four distinct seasons, but the climate is seen to be getting warmer, according to experts and officials who cited annual average temperatures. Several regions of the country have been under daily heat warnings since July 21, issued by the meteorological agency when daily high temperatures exceed 33 degrees Celsius (91 degrees Fahrenheit). REUTERS

author: Guillaume Marion, Media365
title: Real Madrid : Vinicius Jr à nouveau victime d'insultes racistes
text:
Guillaume Marion, Media365 : publié le jeudi 01 février 2024 à 23h55
Avant le match du Real Madrid à Getafe ce jeudi soir, Vinicius Jr a été la cible de plusieurs insultes racistes. Des « Vinicius Mono » (« Vinicius singe ») ont notamment été entendus...
Vinicius Junior sur le racisme : « Je peux changer l'avenir » - Foot - Entretien par L'Équipe
Décidément, ça ne s'arrange pas au niveau du racisme dans le foot. En effet, une dizaine de jours après l'affaire qui a touché Mike Maignan, lors d'une rencontre de l'AC Milan face à l'Udinese en Serie A, c'est cette fois en Espagne qu'une nouvelle sombre histoire a vu le jour ce jeudi 1er février. En marge de la rencontre entre Getafe et le Real Madrid, comptant pour la 20eme journée de Liga, des supporters des Azulones en dehors du stade ont scandé des insultes racistes à l'encontre de Vinicius Jr. Ainsi, selon plusieurs médias espagnols, dont As et la Cope, l'ailier brésilien des Merengue aurait été traité de singe. Sur des vidéos présentes sur X (anciennement Twitter), on peut notamment entendre des « Vinicius Mono » (« Vinicius singe ») , alors que les joueurs de Carlo Ancelotti ont aussi été sifflés aux abords du stade
A Getafe, Vinicius Jr a répondu sur le terrain Après l'affaire qui avait touché Maignan, Vinicius Jr avait notamment passé un coup de gueule nécessaire et disait : « Il est temps d'emprisonner les racistes ». Cette fois, insulté, le Brésilien a répondu à sa manière. Car, ce jeudi soir, au Coliseum Alfonso Pérez, l'ancien joueur de Flamengo s'est illustré lors de la victoire du Real Madrid à Getafe (2-0). Après un premier but de Joselu dès le premier quart d'heure de jeu (14eme), sur une passe de Lucas Vazquez, l'attaquant des Merengue a inscrit un doublé en deuxième période, peu avant l'heure (56eme). Pour faire le break dans cette rencontre, ce dernier a pu profiter d'une passe décisive de Vinicius Jr, qui a donc participé activement au succès des siens. Pour rappel, ce serait au moins la 8eme fois que le Brésilien est victime d'insultes racistes en Espagne , selon As. Les autorités compétentes vont vraiment devoir se poser les bonnes questions pour éradiquer ce fléau présent dans les tribunes.

author: Danielle Halibey

author: Elizabeth Rayne
title: Mosquitos Are a Plague on Humanity. Their Secret Weapon Could Also Save Lives.
text:
By harnessing the unique auditory capabilities of these insects, scientists hope to revolutionize the capabilities of disaster relief efforts. Mosquito antennae are complex structures that transduce sound into electrical signals, which are then zapped to the brain.
Different mosquito species have antennae structured to pick up different sounds, such as frog calls or the sound of female wingbeats.
In the future, the antennae of what we think of as pests could inspire both soundproofing and sound-detecting materials.
Mosquitoes. We swat them, spray them, and otherwise try to get rid of them by any means necessary. But it turns out that these insects—which have been little more than insufferable pest to humanity for most of our existence—might actually be useful for something.
Hypersensitive mosquito antennae are able to pick up specific signals, even through the buzz of their noisy wingbeats, and a team of researchers hoped that finding out how they do it could inspire soundproofing materials and super-sensors. The interdisciplinary team, led by Pablo Zavattieri and Ximena Bernal of Purdue University, zoomed in on the antennae of two mosquito species using microscopy and CT scanning. What they saw were complex structures built to optimize sound detection.
Aedes aegypti and Uranotaenia lowii are mosquito species which use the acute hearing capabilities of their antennae for different purposes. Ae. aegypti males seek out potential mates by listening for female wingbeats, and U. lowii females (which need a blood meal to lay eggs) hunt for frogs to prey…
Elizabeth Rayne
